channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Copenhagen wants to do tourism differently by rewarding visitors with free coffee, food and museum passes if they cycle in the city and keep it clean
item.description: “It is an experimental and a small step towards creating a new mindset amongst travelers,” said Mikkel Aarø-Hansen, CEO of Wonderful Copenhagen.

item.title: Inflation falls 0.1% in June from prior month, helping case for lower rates
CPI report hadn’t shown U.S. retail prices falling since onset of pandemic
Gen Z want to live in expensive cities—instead of moving to the outskirts, their parents are paying their rent
item.description: Young people have always wanted a bustling life and career in the city. The only problem? Gen Z can’t actually afford it.

item.title: Britain's largest water utility placed under special measures as it grapples with $15 billion debt
item.description: Regulators gave Thames Water permission to raise customer bills by an average £99 annually over the next five years, nearly half of what it asked for.

item.title: CPI shows U.S. retail prices falling 0.1% in June, with 0.1% rise at core
The U.K. has ‘far more millionaires than it deserves’ and will watch 500,000 flee to the likes of Italy and Spain by 2028, UBS says
item.description: The U.K. will lose 17% of its millionaires in the coming years, but the country's government shouldn't worry.

item.title: Here are Thursday's biggest analyst calls: Nvidia, Apple, Amazon, Spotify, AMD, Uber, McDonald's
item.description: Here are the biggest calls on Wall Street on

item.title: This JPMorgan cheat sheet pinpoints stocks’ reaction to a range of CPI readings
Ask Andy: Can generative AI solve a startup’s problems?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about startup problems that technology can't solve, and about grappling with a bipolar disorder.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Delta Air Lines, Costco Wholesale, Pfizer and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in premarket trading.

item.title: Coming up: CPI and jobless-claims data — check the weekly economic calendar
U.K. faces highest level of financial distress in Europe with corporate deleveraging at its peak since 2008
item.description: A slowdown in consumer spending impacted the retail fashion sector significantly with 21% of firms in the industry now in distress.

item.title: Virginia is America’s Top State for Business in record-setting 2024, dethroning North Carolina
item.description: Virginia is America's Top State for Business in 2024, with an elite education system and among the nation's best infrastructure.

item.title: Delta’s stock dives after profit miss, downbeat revenue outlook
